reference:
Each observation is a given state in a given year. 
There are a total of 51 states times 23 years = 1,173 observations.
title: More Guns, Less Crime?
description:
Description
Guns is a balanced panel of data on 50 US states, plus the District of Columbia (for a
total of 51 states), by year for 1977–1999.

parameters.density: population per square mile of land area, divided by 1,000.
parameters.male: percent of state population that is male, ages 10 to 29.
parameters.income: real per capita personal income in the state (US dollars).
parameters.population: state population, in millions of people.
parameters.violent: violent crime rate (incidents per 100,000 members of the population).
parameters.cauc: percent of state population that is Caucasian, ages 10 to 64.
parameters.prisoners:
incarceration rate in the state in the previous year
(sentenced prisoners per 100,000 residents; value for the previous year).
parameters.law: factor. Does the state have a shall carry law in effect in that year?
parameters.afam: percent of state population that is African-American, ages 10 to 64.

format: A data frame containing 1,173 observations on 13 variables.
